results.title: Golf: 50 steps to improve your game
results.brief_description: Hosted by professional golf teacher Richard Bradbeer and presented in 5 common sense sections - getting ready, getting started, getting round, getting out of trouble, and getting it in the hole, this tape provides 50 golfing tips for novices and experts alike. Addresses key golfing questions such as “How can I avoid the slice”? “What do I need?” “What’s the best way to tackle the ball?”. As well as many others.

results.title: Golf, the Australian way [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Film Australia and Don Murray
results.brief_description: Golf is a sport in which many Australians excel. The film shows a variety of courses in Australia, explains the problems of course architecture and equipment manufacture, and also features scenes of the world’s top professionals during the 1972 Dunlop International and World Cup Tournaments in Melbourne. Photography by Dean Semler and Mick Bornemann. In Italian language - no English subtitles.

results.title: Golf the Australian way
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Don Murray
results.brief_description: This film is about a sport in which Australians excel - Australians like Crampton, Graham, Devlin and Thompson. The film shows the variety of golf courses in Australia, and explains the many problems of golf course architecture. It also shows equipment manufacture and how videotape playback facilities are used in training young golfers. Scenes with some of the world’s top professionals during the 1972 Dunlop International and World Cup Tournaments in Melbourne are featured. Cinematographer - Dean Semler.

results.title: Golf in Australia
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Antonio Colacino
results.brief_description: Illustrates the wide popularity of golf in Australia, showing the variety of courses and outlining training schemes and other aspects of the sport. Concludes with scenes from professional tournaments.

results.title: Goldwood
results.creator_credit: Robert Verrall, ONF | NFB and Kathleen Shannon
results.brief_description: Goldwood is a search for the early self, in this case the period is associated with life at a previously abandoned gold mine in the northern Ontario wilderness in 1941-42. A woman describes the look and feel of her childhood to an artist friend. The story of her days at Goldwood unfolds through his paintings and live footage of their visit to the site. Nature has reclaimed the land. The adult attempts to reclaim the child. The woman discovers pieces of her doll’s plate lost thirty years earlier. The film evokes the universal feelings of a child in an adult’s world and the awareness of self. Paintings and photography by Blake James.

results.title: Goldtown
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and R. Maslyn Williams
results.brief_description: The story of Australia’s fabulous town with the “golden mile” - Kalgoorlie in Western Australia, a goldmining town in the midst of a forbidding desert where the water supply is piped hundreds of miles overland.

results.title: Goldmining in Australia
results.brief_description: This film is about the Kalgoorlie gold mine and processing plant in Western Australia. Shows how the gold is transported on railway trucks for final sorting, washing and smeltering to finally become gold bullions.
results.description: This film is about the Kalgoorlie gold mine and processing plant in Western Australia. Shows how the gold is transported on railway trucks for final sorting, washing and smeltering to finally become gold bullions.

results.title: Goldilocks and the three bears. The Little mermaid
results.creator_credit: Libby Simon, Home Box Office and Edward Bell
results.brief_description: Two animated and humorous adaptations of fairy tales for children. “Goldilocks and the three bears”: Goldilocks is a girl from a tropical village, an impish scallywag with an uncompromising attitude, unfazed even when getting others into strife. But when she wanders into a forest she meets a spider, snake and bat, who try to warn her off the three bears that could land her in serious trouble. This amusing and funky short underpins the values of friendship and selflessness. “The Little mermaid”: Beneath the hustle and bustle of Taipei international trading port, a secret underwater kingdom exists where a mermaid, Princess Mija and her best friend, a starfish named Nuri, live happily under the watchful eye of Queen Hul-muh-ni. At fifteen years of age, Mija’s life changes forever when she falls for a human prince and has to choose between love and life in the ocean with her family. Features the voices of Tia Carrere, Margaret Cho, Raven Symone, Alfre Woodard, Jennifer Lewis and Lou Rawls.

results.title: Goldilocks and the three bears
results.creator_credit: Zdenka Deitchova, Weston Woods Studios and Milan Klikar
results.brief_description: The traditional story of “Goldilocks and the three bears” is told in this short animated children’s film. When the Three Bears go out, mischievous Goldilocks enters their house and wrecks havoc. Based on the book by James Marshall.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Zdenka Deitchova, Weston Woods Studios and Milan Klikar

results.title: Goldilocks and the three bears
results.brief_description: The story of Goldilocks and the three bears, remaining faithful to the incidents and characterizations of the original tale. Suggestions for drawing pictures of the scenes of the story and for exploring other favourite stories provide children with an incentive for reading and artwork activities.
